programme.title: The Unbelievable With Dan Aykroyd
programme.desc: A blind man who uses bat-like powers of echolocation to navigate his surroundings, a samurai with reflexes faster than a speeding bullet, and a man whos immune to electrocution.

programme.title: Greatest Heists With Pierce Brosnan
programme.desc: An armoured-car depot employee uses his insider knowledge to plan a heist that could net him, and the longtime friends he recruits, more than $18 million in cash.

programme.title: Historys Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: The search for the Northwest Passage leads to a historic expedition that sets sail into a labyrinth of ice and is never heard from again. That disappearance sparks a search spanning two centuries. What killed the men of the Franklin Expedition?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Day It is the shortest day of the year so the sun doesnt rise until very late and is going to set very early. To Little Nutbrown Hare everything feels mixed up and theres no time to do all the things he wants to do. That’s until he and Little Field Mouse name it Topsy-Flopsy Day and decide to make a fun and funny day of it!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: In Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends try to find an extra special place and extra special food for Feast Day celebrations. When things go awry and nothing seems special at all, they discover that the most important thing is to be able to celebrate with those you love. Theme: celebrating with those you love.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and his friends are making paper planes but Timmy needs some help from Finlay. Help Timmy decide which transport comes next.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle and the gang hear strange mumbling voices in the Busytown Museum, it begins to look like it’s coming from the new Mummy Exhibit. However, after tracking down the clues and putting them together, the sounds turn out to be the voices of the workmen echoing up through air vents from the basement.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy is playing with his toy planes, cars and boats and wonders how they all work, so he goes to Okido to find out! When he arrives, Felix and Zoe, they tell him to hurry because they want to watch the “All Okido Race to Windy Hill” with him. “There’s a mystery prize!” they tell him. Messy says they won’t watch the race… because they’re going to be in the race and win! He whistles over the Okidoodle and they skidoodle to the starting line!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy can’t reach a sock in the top drawer! He wonders if he’ll ever be tall enough.“When you need to know, go to Okido!” he says. Messy gets to Okido just in time to catch Felix and Zoe leaving to meet Zim, Zam and Zoom at the funfair! They jump into the Okidoodle, but Felix accidentally lets go of the funfair map, which flies away! Messy stops and luckily, Lofty the giant was there to catch it for them. Lofty is with his niece Mini, and so they invite her to the funfair with them. “Mini’s a bit too big for the Okidoodle” notices Messy, so she follows behind on her scooter.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When Huckleberry and Blueberry’s Patti Persimmon-style mystery story is rejected by the online mystery magazine, Strawberry comes up with a new way to raise funds for Huck’s pet shelter—a big dog show! Plum attempts to turn the dog show into an extravagant dance performance. The competition heats up, everyone wanting their pup to perform in an even more spectacular manner, and the dog training sessions go comically awry. Meanwhile Huck and Blueberry co-write a monster mystery, inadvertently starting a rumor that a Berry Patch monster is loose! The rumor, combined with Jadeybug from the post office forgetting to send out the show invitations, results in no one coming to the show. Fortunately, Blueberry had submitted her and Huck’s new mystery story to the online magazine, and the editor is thrilled with their work.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is pleased when he wins a game he is playing with Nana so he visits Dino-World where he makes up lots of games and wins every time.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wants to do lots of things all at once so instead of choosing one activity he goes to Dino-World.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Peyo and Pico play hide and seek in a forest clearing in the Paraguana Peninsula, but their game takes an unexpected turn when Pico gets tangled in spider web, triggering an angry tarantula. Leo, Katie, and Hero enjoy dancing in the garden until they receive a distress call from Peyo, who tells them about the tarantula. They learn about the tarantulas habitat and behavior before Peyo gets bitten by the spider during the call. Leo, Katie and Hero fly to Peyo and Katie treats Peyo’s spider bite but suddenly, the tarantula and Pico go missing! After searching the area, they find the tarantula… upside down, to their worries. Ranger Rocky shows up and they reach out to Ranger Joey for further information and learn that the spider is in the process of molting and with no web to protect it. Hero chases Pico and accidentally bumps into Katie who drops the bandage she used earlier and this gives Leo an idea. They all wait in the bush while a snake approaches the bush with the spider in it but turns away as it is met with a makeshift spider web made from the bandage. The spider can now molt safely and Ranger Rocky mentions he will come back to clean up the bandage once it is done molting. Mission accomplished, and back at the treehouse, Katie surprises Leo by mastering the dance steps they practiced earlier but is bumped by Hero.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas helps Ruth fix up an old windmill into her new, energy-efficient workshop.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When the Rickety Old Bridge collapses, trapping Toby and Henrietta on the other side of the ravine, Inventor Ruth is asked to build a new one.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: At the request of Emma the forest ranger, Grisu has to tag the sick trees in the forest. The trees must absolutely be cut down before the storm arrives. But all the marks he makes are erased by a mysterious eraser: Fume, who is determined to defend his tree. Grisu finds a solution by using his father to replant the tree sheltered from the wind.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Olivia competes in the famous Sand Dune Race in a new electric 4x4 she has designed, but her co-pilot has just pulled out. Fortunately, Grisu will take his place. Accompanied by Fume and Stella, he joins Olivia in the desert. The race begins and soon Slad and Vlad - better known as “The Tricktwins” - give them a hard time. The twins, ready to do anything to win, try to trick them. While Grisu and Olivias charred windsceen prevents them from moving forward, Grisu has an idea that allows them to get back in the race. Before crossing the finish line, they even help the Tricktwins to get out of a quicksand.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse befriend a little green caterpillar but arent prepared for the changes it will undergo.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse see a beautiful rainbow. When it disappears before Big Nutbrown Hare can see it, they recreate it for him with flowers.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn a passenger service badge, Wilson must speak up, be nice to his passengers, and smile at all times – no matter what happens! His passengers know that it’s a test, and go out of their way to make things very challenging for Wilson - but he keeps smiling and earns his badge.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Grandpa and Grandma have come to look after the children. In the afternoon, Grandma goes for a walk in the forest with Scoutbadger, Rosie and Berry. Grandpa stays in the burrow with Woodsy who thinks he is going to have a quiet time but things turn out to be more hectic than he had anticipated.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Team Bob are creating a Soft Play Cafe for Chef Tattie in an old warehouse by the docks, ready for an opening party tomorrow. Though the build is on track, Chef can’t decide what colour to paint the disco room so Bob offers to put up paint samples for him to choose from. Leo shows off his ‘mash-up’ app and Tattie decides that Leo should DJ for the party. However, Leo isn’t as confident as he appeared to Chef and the extra responsibility distracts him from the build. Eventually he ends up walking through spilled paint after putting up the colour samples, leaving differently coloured footprints all over the floor.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Leo is late as he’s overslept thanks to staying up late playing a fishing game on his phone. Bob, Lofty, Leo and Wendy are installing a satellite dish and at the Spring City News HQ located at the docks. The dish has to be in place in time for the Six O’Clock News bulletin. En route to site the team stop to say hello to the Spring City Rockets who are practicing in preparation for a dance show later that day which will be covered on the news. On site Leo and Lofty are teamed up. During the build Leo is distracted by the game; Lofty suggests he should pay more attention. While tying the dish to Lofty’s hook Leo - distracted by the game - does not secure it properly. As Lofty raises the dish it comes loose and drops to the floor.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Baby Sadies dolly has mysteriously gone missing somewhere between home and the band shell in Busytown Park. Huckle and his team search for clues at all the places Sadie visited that day. They discover the dolly inside a grand piano thats playing a few sour notes./Cars are disappearing from a particular parking space, Huckle and gang set out to find out why.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A swim in the garden brings Leo and Hero up close and personal with a Malayan water monitor. The Junior Rangers set out to search for the monitor’s home, but will their jeep survive a river crossing after a jeep float gets punctured?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Imagine Leo’s surprise when he realises that a piece of seaweed in his aquarium is actually a leafy seadragon! The Junior Rangers set forth to put the leafy seadragon back in Australian waters, but their mission changes course when they have to save leafy seadragons that have been washed ashore.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: When Simon, Lou and Ferdinand hear a strange noise near their cabin while playing, they run away and vow not to go into the cabin again. This sounds like a job for superheroes!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Leapy, the grasshopper girl, gets paint on her hair while painting her house in the spring. She can’t wash it off, so Zephyr, the dragonfly, offers to cut her hair. Leapy is very sad when she sees herself in the mirror; she doesn’t like her new hairstyle. At Zephyrs suggestion, they show the others, but only Dolly notices the change and compliments her. Later, they hold a hairstyle day, where everyone creates special hairstyles for themselves. Leapy happily finishes painting her house and invites her friends to a spring feast.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Stanleys birthday is approaching, and he becomes very curious and can’t wait to find out what gift he will receive from Dolly. He peeks into the ladybird girls drawer. The next day, he tells Balthazar that he knows what his gift will be. On his birthday, the friends gather and wish Stanley a happy birthday. Flutter presents the cake, they sing, and then Stanley blows out the candles and cuts the cake. Stanley receives many nice gifts, including a bowling set from Dolly. Stanley admits that he peeked into the ladybird girls drawer because he was curious about his gift.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Shaun invites his friends to Sand Island during the summer heatwave. Christopher and Chloe, the two canaries, ferry the friends over. Bubble, Balthazar, Dolly, Stanley, Berry, Flutter, and Shaun build sand houses. Balthazar accidentally knocks down Bubble the flower beetles house. Suddenly, a summer shower begins and washes away all the sand houses. They stand sadly around their ruined creations and decide to build a large drip sandcastle together. Side by side, they build drip towers, construct castle walls, and decorate the tops with sand balls. The day passes joyfully, and by the evening, when the canaries come to pick them up, magnificent drip towers stand tall on the island.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: At the end of summer, the Star Girl visits her friends. She rarely comes because her star-shaped house is in the sky. They spend a day together, and when night falls, the Star Girl bids everyone farewell. She can’t speak, but she plays the harp beautifully. The music will lift her house into the sky. However, this time one of the harp strings comes loose, and the house doesn’t rise. The Wind blows the string out of her hand, and she can’t catch it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Centipedes apple tree hasn’t had any fruit for many years. He asks Berry for help, who carefully tends to the tree. At the beginning of summer, apples finally appear, and the Centipede is so happy that he invites his distant relative, the Millipede, for a visit. However, the Millipede falls ill and can’t come. The Centipede then invites his friends to a big apple party. When they arrive, they pretend that the Millipede was there, but it turns out that it was just his friends in costume.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Cave Spider and the tiny Spiderling are good friends, and one summer day they are walking on the mountaintop. Spiderling blows a dandelion at the Cave Spider, who falls and gets injured. Spiderling immediately seeks help from Doctor Owl, who determines that the Cave Spiders legs are bruised and prescribes two weeks of rest. Berry, Dolly, Stanley, and Balthazar help the Cave Spider get home. Dolly suggests they sew a large canopy so the Cave Spider can watch the ants end-of-summer fireworks from the air. Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr, and the others make the canopy, and on the night of the fireworks, they lift the Cave Spider up so he can enjoy the view from above.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a spring day, Alfonso finds an unknown seedling by the stream. The cricket carefully guards the plant, which soon produces a special flower. Alfonso waters and tends to it daily, happily watching it grow. One morning at the end of summer, Alfonso notices that the flower has wilted and its petals have fallen off. Sadly, he gathers the petals and brings them into the house. In the afternoon, Dolly visits him, and later his friends come over to cheer him up. They bring delicious pancakes, but Alfonso is still sad. They go out to the stream, and Alfonso scatters the flower petals into the water, bidding them farewell with tears.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is disappointed he cant go play because hes all sneezy but Sula and Amma bring him a nice carroty bagel to help him get better.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is playing Hide And Seek at the crèche with Sula, Pando and Coco. Bing doesn’t go to the toilet with all the others before the game starts and when he needs to go before he is found he has to decide whether to give up his hiding place or try and hold on.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are making ginger bunny biscuits for Charlie and Coco.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is Its a Bing thing! which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: It’s National Hugging Day! All the friends hug each other, except for Rupert. Tilda knows there’s something wrong! Rupert is afraid his spines could hurt anyone. But Tilda already has an idea.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly is excited for her friend Mings visit and to show her favourite spot. However, Ming keeps getting distracted. Molly eventually goes alone, but Ming finds her, and the picnic can finally begin.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert builds a tree from wood instead of cutting one down. Soon, everyone wants one too, and the friends are so busy they forget the Advent celebration. The children decorate and save the day.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Crisp Autumn days are perfect for collecting pretty golden leaves and playing hide and boo. Little Nutbrown Hare is so excited that he accidently promises to play with two different games with two different friends on the same day. He can’t be in two places at once, so how will he keep both his promises and both his friends happy?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A fun, spooky tale from little White Owl leaves the friends a little on edge, so when they hear strange noises in the pumpkin patch, they wonder what kind of creepy creature might be lurking there with them. Will Big Nutbrown Hare be able to convince them not to let their imaginations run away with them?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The friends are all playing together in the Autumn meadow. Little Redwood Fox inadvertently spoils all the games of the day, but the others put their heads together and come up with a game that suits her perfectly.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard both have nightmares because of the dragon story Grandma read them just before going to bed. Grandma tries to calm them down by giving them a glass of water but once back in bed, Gaspard can only think of the dragon. Simon joins him in his bed but then there is a noise under their bunk beds and they run off to Grandpa and Grandma’s bedroom, believing there is a dragon in the room. But Grandpa is quick to discover the real identity of the dragon: it’s Elvis, their dog!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo finds a blue pansy caterpillar, and the Junior Rangers set off to find a home for it. On the way, they come upon other blue pansy caterpillars and butterflies, whose home will be destroyed soon. Can the Junior Rangers find a new home for all these blue pansies?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Koko is put in charge of Wilson and Brewster. The team has to complete a newspaper round by a certain time. Koko nearly fails and learns that being bossy isn’t the best way to lead. She tries again, using her team members’ strengths instead and in the end shares her badge with Wilson and Brewster. After all – they’re a team!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: The trainees have to assess each other as they do braking tests in the park. Wilson doesn’t do so well – and the trainees consider reporting that he did better than he actually did. In the end, Wilson decides they should be honest to Vee, even if it means forfeiting his badge – but Vee tells them the badge wasn’t for braking, but for good judgment, which they’ve shown by telling the truth!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is sad when he learns that Plume the rabbit has hurt her paw. He and Nina decide to take their little furry friend into T’choupi’s bedroom: she’ll be safe in there and able to get a good rest while they take good care of her. T’choupi’s certain this is a good solution. But little does he know… cheeky little Plume has other ideas…!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: It’s Father’s Day today. But neither T’choupi nor Nina can come up with a good idea for a special present for their respective dads. Benedicte suggests they gather up various objects from the forest and make drawings with them, on the ground. Great idea… except land art turns out to be a bit more complicated than they expected. And, more importantly, are their dads even going to like it?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi and Nina come across a waddling hedgehog while they’re playing in the vegetable garden. When their moms explain how beneficial these cute little creatures are to gardens, the two friends decide to do everything they can to make the hedgehog feel at home among the vegetables… Until the little animal… disappears!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: The children must all pair up and prepare a nursery rhyme along with a little dance. Paulie and Charley recite The fruit ball and come up with a cute little dance. Except that once they get up to perform in front of the class, they get stage-fright!! Lily, who had been helping them rehearse, will help them through it. Thank you Lily!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Invited to dinner at Sams house, Julia makes a stain on the tablecloth while Sams mom is away. Time is running : can Sam and Julia wash the stain and fix Julias big mistake before the dinner?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia pretended to Sam she can do real magic. To prove him so, Julia has to find a way to do that. She will have to find different tricks to let her friend believe she really is a magician.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Marion is woken by a long line of dinosaurs going past in the moonlight. Convinced it is a dream, they return the next day and chase her to the castle.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: The first time Samson came to Sodor he got lost. But Samson is a very proud engine and he doesn’t like to admit his mistakes. So he finds it very hard to listen to the other engines trying to warn him that he is making a mistake again when he accidentally takes Gordon’s Express Coaches to the quarry, instead of the trucks used for carrying stone.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillous class pet - Gerald the Hamster - passes away the night before Caillou is due to take him home for the weekend.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Rosie is scared to go to the dentist for the first time, so Caillou tries to prove its not as scary as it seems!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Something knocks Sgt. Murphy’s hat off his head, chops the tops of Baker Humperdink’s baguettes, and sheers a path through a flower bed. Although no one saw anything, they all heard it make the same whoop whoop whoop sound. Putting the clues together, Huckle, Sally and Lowly figure out that it was Vanderbuilt’s new, out of control, boomerang./The mysterious disappearance of Mayor Fox leaves Huckle and the gang on an important search.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey and parrot are playing hide and seek, Monkey is boasting of his great hiding skills when in fact Parrot finds him each time. Mole suggests going to Chameleon who is known as the hiding expert.... They are off to the forest to find the chameleon. Chameleon gives them some hiding tips and joins them in a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!!!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey the artist is looking for something to draw but nothing inspires him. Mole appears and shares about the beauty and color design of butterflies. Monkey loves the idea and they set off to the meadow in search of the Butterfly. Once they arrive, they meet a magnificent butterfly who just came out of his chrysalis. They watch him move and play a game of Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When party celebrations go wrong and help is needed, Fireman Sam and his crew are here to save the day in Pontypandy.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The kids learn how to slow-cook potatoes outdoors with Moose, but their hunger gets them cranky. The new Jupiter causes a frenzy at the fire station.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: When Franklin sprains his ankle and has to wear a temporary brace on his leg, he quickly grows frustrated that he can’t do all the things he usually does – until he realizes it’s a chance to do new things and even play new games. / Green Wonder and the Super Cluepers are focused on solving the case of the missing school bell and some other cool mysteries around Woodland – until Franklin realizes that helping out and solving the unexpected problems right in front of them feels really good too.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Berry sees a shooting star in the sky and makes a wish to become a princess, Princess Berry. To spare her from being disappointed, Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy pretend that she has indeed really become a princess. But Princess Berry turns out to be a very demanding princess…

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who is the King of Cuddling? Doodleboo explains how to draw a cat.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What really makes a vacation unforgettable? Doodbleboo explains how to draw a Camera

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who never risks getting a sunburn? Doodleboo explains how to draw a vampire

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave use all of their five senses, seeing, hearing, smell, taste and touch to find each other, and Hatty’s hat, in a fun game of Hide and Seek.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Hatty takes our trio to Music Land in search of a band for Tweet to sing with. In a world where everything makes music, they each find a musical instrument to play and end up being the band themselves!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is very proud of a Christmas Tree he has built from pine cones. So proud, that when Little Field Mouse accidentally knocks it over he has trouble forgiving her. When he makes a mistake of his own, Big Nutbrown Hare forgives him immediately, and he understands how important it is to forgive.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Seeing his tracks in the fresh snow inspires Little Nutbrown Hare to create a new game called ‘snow seek’. The friends have a lot of fun creating tracks for Little Nutbrown Hare to follow, but Little Redwood Fox’s tracks completely disappear and so does she. When Big Nutbrown Hare reports that Little Redwood Fox was sighted walking backwards, they work out how she managed to trick them all.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Amma have come to Bings house for lunch but there are no carrots so Flop pops to the shop to get some. Bing stays behind but its not long before he starts to miss Flop. Missing Flop... its a Bing thing!

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco is staying at Bings house for her first sleepover but things dont go so well when they find out their different bedtime routines.

programme.title: Timmy Time Christmas Surprise Pe
programme.desc: Join Timmy and his friends as they get very excited on Christmas Eve! However, after a blizzard they get snowed in and have to make the most of creating a lovely and Christmassy atmosphere!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is very proud of his tail and the wonderful things he can do with it. He thinks his tail is the greatest until he sees Peacock’s tail. programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: While trying to win a big snowbowling tournament, Monkey discovers that one of his bowling pins is a penguin! A penguin is perfect for Monkey’s favorite game….. Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Norman and Hannah set themselves up as The Why Files - investigators of the mysterious mysteries of Pontypandy - one of their first cases involves strange goings on near the cliffs.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sarah puts on a captivating lunchtime theatre show outside the Wholefish Cafe. Its so good that Charlie doesnt notice his stove burst into flames

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate is playing with Mim-Mim when she realizes that his tail has come off! In Mimiloo, Mim-Mim frets over being tailless. Worse yet, none of his friends recognize him without it! Since Mim-Mim’s tail moves in different ways depending on how he feels, Kate will have to pay special attention to Mim-Mim’s feelings to get it back.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate and Mom are enjoying a picnic when a bird eats Kate’s muffin! In Mimiloo, Gobble and Tack argue over how to stop gadzookie flies from eating Gobble’s crops. Hurt, they each decide they need a new best friend. Kate and Mim-Mim work to get the best friends back together, but can they do it before the gadzookie flies return?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are excited to be looking after a guest - a friend’s unique rooster by the name of Rigoletto. They ask Fred what makes it so unique but he’s not sure; all he knows is that they need to take good care of it. However, despite being housed in its very own enclosure, Rigoletto escapes and goes missing!! Huh! Maybe the animal’s uniqueness will allow the kids to track it down…?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Ciboulette the cat has stolen Fanni’s plush toy, making the little girl extremely sad. T’choupi and Nina are determined to get the toy back but the cat refuses to comply! After several vain attempts at approaching Ciboulette, the two friends receive unexpected assistance… from the chickens!.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia dreams of joining the residences brass band, except that to do so, she must come with a musical instrument. Sam builds one for her, but Julia is too impatient to listen at her friends advice.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia and Sam must babysit Ben. A game of hide and seek is launched in the residence. But Sams little brother is so well hidden that he cant be found. Where could he be hiding?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Molly visits Tilda, her friend is looking for a birthday present for Rupert. In the end, Tilda decides on a blue scarf. Molly suggests sending Rupert the present as a parcel to make the surprise all the bigger. A great idea, thinks Tilda.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: In Grandpa’s garden, Turbulent is fascinated by the super heroes’ stories he can read in his book. He wishes too to be a Kind Vigilante who saves the lovely and the helpless. Unfortunately, every time he tries to save someone, his sister who stucked her kite in a tree or his brother who is afraid of a spider for example, Grandpa always comes first and fixes the problem. When Turbulent was at the most discouraging point, a new villain appears ant kidnap all the people he loves, the Kind Vigilante is back in business!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are playing in the park when Mommy calls them because it’s time to go home. When they arrive she asks them if Toto is not with them but the Triplets thought he was already with Mommy! What a disaster! Toto is lost! It’s the total panic, the Triplets are desperate and worst, the park is about to close! Everyone starts to look for Toto, Grandpa makes the tour of the neighborhood, Mommy hangs signs everywhere and calls the Police. We absolutely need to find him !

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Near the riverbank, Rosie, Woodsy and Scoutbadger find a glass jar containing a genuine pirate map! Without a second thought, our heroes decide to go search for the treasure. Quick as ever, Rosie and Scoutbadger spot the clues and solve the puzzles,without noticing that Woodsy has a hard time keeping pace with them. The poor badger feels more and more useless, and eventually decides to give up the search…

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and Leo visit the beach and build sand castles, play frisbee, and paddleboard!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou learns what to do when others are being mean.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas loves to race against Max and Monty, the cheeky dumper trucks. But, after one near accident too many, he decides he must ignore them if he wants to get on and be Useful. But, without Thomas to race against, Max and Monty muck about at the building site and Oliver is damaged. Then they race against the other construction vehicles, to see who can get their work done quickest. Rather than driving all the way to the dump, Max and Monty chuck all their building debris over a wall… not realising that the rubble is blocking Thomas’s branch line! When Thomas returns with Oliver, he ploughs into the pile of dirt and rocks and is derailed. So Max and Monty have to stay up all night clearing the line!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: At the Chug - a - sonic Speed Track, Hanzo teaches Koko to control her new engine booster and she learns to brake at high - speed. Brewster discovers he has a good eye for track laying when he spots a buckled rail.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Koko’s speed booster malfunctions and she speeds around Chuggington out of control. Chug Patrol get ready to rescue her with some strong nets, but even they can’t stop Koko. Brewster has been crushing rocks and saves the day by dropping dust onto Koko, which clogs up her booster and finally brings her to a standstill.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: The children must all pair up and prepare a nursery rhyme along with a little dance. Paulie and Charley recite The fruit ball and come up with a cute little dance. Except that once they get up to perform in front of the class, they get stage-fright!! Lily, who had been helping them rehearse, will help them through it. Thank you Lily!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave follow recipes to make their favourite fruit and vegetable juice drinks. They collect the fresh ingredients from Hatty’s garden and count out the quantities of each one needed to make A Ruff-Ruff Super Juice, Tweet’s Sweet Treat and Dave’s Bubbly Banana Juice. Then it’s into Hatty’s Bubble-Juicer they go, for some juicing magic!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: With just a few strokes of his pencil, Doodleboo always manages to do a funny drawing that comes to life as soon as it has been coloured.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a hot summer day, Berry, Dolly, Bubble and Balthazar put on their swimsuits, looked for their buckets, shovels and started to build the loveliest sand castle on the Sand Island.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a sunny autumn day, Berry and Dolly went into to forest to pick blueberries. Flutter, the butterfly girl, and Eddy, the potato beetle joined them as well. When Eddy saw the fruitful bushes can’t help but pick all the best fruits before the others. What’s left to do?

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: It’s December, and it’s gingerbread time! Berry and Dolly love making them. Berry’s house filled with the wonderful smell of the biscuits what the magpie immediately noticed from above. Grabbed the bowl and flew away with it. Oh my!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon after a heavy storm Leapy, the grasshopper found an injured stranger, He immediately called for help. Berry and Dolly arrived in no time as always.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly are planting sunflowers on a spring day. They take care of the flowers carefully as they emerge from the ground and grow tall. The two friends are very happy. Unfortunately the joy does not last long; someone damaged the flowers.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Charlie is coming to play and Bing has planned lots of things for them to do. But when Charlie arrives he doesn’t want to play any of the games Bing has put out. Bing is upset until Flop suggests they watch to see what Charlie really wants to do. Charlie heads straight for the kitchen where he, and Bing, have a great time making music with pots and pans.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop see Pando skateboarding and Bing wants a go but its a lot harder than it looks and Bing falls off. Pando finds a clever way to help Bing get his confidence back.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: At Ammas crèche a butterfly lands on Sulas painting. Bing tries to help it go outside but accidentally squishes it. Flop and Amma help the sad children say goodbye.

programme.desc: The playful rabbit wants to draw a big picture, so Flop finds him some chalk to create a stripy, spotty, zig-zag dinosaur on the pavement

programme.title: Bing Bunny

Amma shows them how to plant both bits of potato so that they can grow new potatoes.

Bad goes to comically worse as the girls discover he can’t act, can’t dance, can’t sing, suffers from extreme stage fright, and never really wanted to do the play in the first place. After dress rehearsal devolves into a comedy of errors, Strawberry finally gets the sheepish Huck to confess that acting, singing and dancing are just not for him.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Scoutbadger has made a bet with Pico that his father, Edmund, who never gives the children any lessons, will be there tomorrow. He has, of course, been a little hasty as, for Edmund, this is out of the question.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Summer meadow is home to a many amazing treasures of nature. Meanwhile, Big Nutbrown Hare has discovered the biggest blue treasure of them all. What could it be?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes early one Summer morning before the sun has risen. programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry wants to perform magic, but Stanley and Balthazar tease him. Berry borrows Katies magic box, learns tricks, and puts on a show for his friends. The tricks amaze the audience, especially when Berry successfully performs real magic by summoning rain.

programme.desc: Sam and Julia want to play as if they own a restaurant. But its not so easy to decide on the menu, the name of the place, and to manage their first difficult customers, Ella and Tonio.

programme.desc: While playing against Tonio, Julia lost Sams beautiful marble. The two mice do everything to recover it, but Julia would like to understand why this marble was so precious to him...

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: While buying pastries at Mrs Bun’s bakery, mom puts up a flyer for a babysitter. A baby sitter for the Triplets? « Out of the question! », reply the three kids in unison. After making sure that the first applicants never manage to reach their mom on the phone, Eliott, a teenage boy, gets to try out for the job. But the Triplets have more than one trick up their sleeves and have decided to drive the poor Eliott completely crazy. Mom comes home to a most surprising scene: the poor boy is asleep on the couch and the triplets are quietly playing cards.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Poet was quietly sitting on the pot when he suddenly heard a horrible sound and quickly ran away, convinced that a dragon was hiding in the toilet. The triplets called their Grandpa for help, but he only managed to stop the roaring temporarily. He must be hungry, suggests Girl, so why not feed him the roast? Another miss, but Toto had a feast! Good thing Mom called a real dragon hunter to the rescue, a plumber, and everything returns to normal. There is just one slight problem: there is nothing left for dinner!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Brewster encounters the oldest tree in Chuggington.

programme.title: Fireman Sam

It takes everyone to figure out who the original jokester is—things aren’t always what they seem!

In Mimiloo, after Mim-Mim accidentally ruins a one-of-a-kind music recording, Kate, Mim-Mim and their friends visit the Singing Seas where Callie, a giant octopus, keeps her Mega Music Maker. But it’s broken! Kate leads the gang on a quest to fix the island-sized instrument.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou feels intimidated when Billy, Clementine’s brother, shows off some super cool moves at the skate park. Caillou pretends to be Skip Super, facing off against Giant Rexy while helping new superhero, Kick-Flip (Billy), overcome his feelings of inadequacy to help save the day.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D)
programme.desc: Caillou gets carried away with generosity when at the neighbourhood Give and Take and he gives Rosie’s doll away without asking. In a Pirate fantasy where his treasure is given to a sea monster, Caillou learns that it’s not right to give things away that don’t belong to you.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: While Thomas is working on the Indian railway, Rajiv learns that he can be really useful with or without his crown

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari was backpacking through the forest where she discovers a bunch of discarded leaves and branches on the floor due to the aftermath of the storm. As she investigate further, the wind blows a paper cup near her. Zari was perplexed as she mistaken the insect with an actual leaf, causing her to call in the Rangers. Back at the headquarters, Leo is searching for Hero and Katie as theyre playing hide And seek. As Leo is struggling to find Katie, he receives a call from Zari, who asks for help with the strange animal. Leo and Katie travels with PlatypusOne to reach Zari. As they arrived, Zari tells them to be careful because the leaves on the ground could be a Malayan Leaf insect too. After carefully going investigate and not finding any, the wind manage to blow the Malayan Leaf insect out of Katies hand. Leo chases it down with his jetpack, manage to safe the animal from harm. The gang then tries to find a proper place for the insect. They then stumble a new location, where a mouse-deer is nearby. Leo put the insect on a high branch, when suddenly they got greeted by Ranger Rocky. He then calls for Ranger Joey for more information on the Malayan Leaf Insect, where she fully explains its habitat and predators that may appear. She advices them that the mouse-deer might mistake the insect as an actual leaf and would eat it, where Leo take the advice and put the insect somewhere higher on the trees. The Rangers went home where Leo put the Malayan Leaf insect photo on the wall. He then figured to look for Katie and hero to continue their game earlier, but Katie and Hero was already inside the treehouse, indifferent to Leos game. Ranger Rocky finally thanks them for a great job on the computer screen.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Farah is drawing poop on her handbook in the national park, she hears a loud growl nearby and leaps onto her dirtbike to seek the source. She sees a lioness and her cub stuck inside a man-made well, clumsily failing to get out. She immediately calls the Rangers for help. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie were playing frisbee. Katie tries to do throw it just like Leo does it but she fails, upsetting her. As Leo instructs Katie on how to do it, he receives the call from Farah. Farah tells them about the trapped animals, causing the duo to learn more about the lion back in the treehouse. Farah then informs them of more lions coming over, where Leo tells her to get to safety first. As the Rangers arrive and land PlatypusOne from afar, Leo uses his binoculars and sees the 2 female lions still roaming around the well. They see Farah hides on top of a nearby hill and meet her there. As they were discussing on how to help the lioness, Katie points out a fallen log nearby that can be used. Farah misunderstood and rush onto her bike to cause a distraction for the 2 lioness around the well, but Ranger Rocky appears and stops her. Ranger Rocky then ask more information on the Asiatic Lion from Ranger Joey. Ranger Joey advices them about the Asiatic Lions hunting behavior, giving the group an idea to pretend as a Sambar Deer to distract the animal there.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pats special mission is to deliver a family of hibernating fruit bats to Amy.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat must find some missing duck eggs before they start to hatch, and get them to Amy.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to play his car park game, but Charlie is visiting and keeps messing it up.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop play shadow tag until it starts raining and Bings shadow is outside getting wet.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald wakes up to hear the sounds of a parade passing outside his window. He and Weenie persuade Henry and Daisy to come to the parade, where Oswald promises them all kinds of exciting sights. But it turns out there is no parade - just Steve Tree carrying a radio. Henry and Daisy are annoyed that Oswald got them all worked up for nothing. But Oswald tells them they can have their own parade, and he organises a makeshift band to march through Big City Park.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Henry is sad because he cant fly like other birds. Oswald and Daisy try to help him realise his dream. Madame Butterfly gives him wing-flapping lessons, Daisy pushes him around on her unicycle, they all try to stir up a breeze, but nothing can get him airborne. Then the Egg Twins blow a giant bubble that envelops Henry and flies him over Big City!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team have been busy building a new water park, “Spring City Splash” that includes a wave pool and splash zone. Now there is only one thing left to build... the double dragon water slide. Scoop loves dragons and cannot wait to help build the slides, but when he is asked to help build the support beams instead, he is less than impressed with his job. As Bob attaches the new water park entrance sign, Scoop digs foundations for the support beams. Suddenly Scoop becomes distracted with the arrival of the dragon slides and doesn’t finish the foundations. He attempts to see the dragon slides only to be sent back to finish his job. Now totally eager to get to the slides, Scoop rushes to complete his job and doesn’t realise that the support beams are not set and are beginning to lean.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Leo and Muck are having great fun playing the very latest computer game “Space Robots!” Bob reminds them they’ve got an early start in the morning. Muck pleads to stay up a bit longer and Leo promises they’ll get a good night’s sleep…just as soon as they reach the top level of the game. But at dawn they’re still playing! Next morning, Leo and Muck are very tired and sleepy. Bob explains that they have to finish building The Spring City Wheel, a huge Ferris-wheel, in the Docklands Regeneration Area. He’s promised the Spring City Rockets they’ll be the first to ride on it - today! Bob and the gang drive towards the site but on the way Muck and Leo stop to have a quick nap.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Can you guess how much I love you? Little Nutbrown Hare asks his father. Big Nutbrown Hare looks up at the big, old oak tree. As much as the Old Oak Tree is big? he asks. Little Nutbrown Hare holds up an acorn in triumph. No, as big as this acorn! He replies. Because this acorn will just keep growing and growing and growing.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One morning in the early Springtime, Little Nutbrown Hare wakes to find the air filled with a delightful smell. He and Little Field Mouse search all over the meadow, the woods and by the riverside to find the source of the wonderful smell. They discover all kinds of new and unexpected Spring scents… sweet, pretty and fresh, but will they find the one they are searching for?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare watches as Blue Bird’s eggs hatch into three happy, chirpy baby birds. Fascinated and charmed by these youngsters, he visits them every day and even helps teach them to sing, play and fly. But how will he feel when Summer is on its way and they are ready to fly the nest and make homes of their own?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and his friends are playing pirates. Where is the treasure in the garden?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Mr. Rabbit makes up coupons for free cookies to celebrate the grand opening of his cookie shop and gives them to his young son to drop in the mailbox outside. But the coupons never arrive. After chasing down the clues from the mail carrier to the post office and back again, Huckle determines that Jr Rabbit mistakenly dropped the coupons into the trash container beside the mail box. /A model boat is mysteriously broken and Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to discover how it happened.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world Messy is in his kitchen and he is really hungry… His tummy thinks it’s lunchtime already! “My tummy’s not very good at telling the time” he says, “but what is time anyway? Hm, when you need to know, go to Okido!” He lands with a jump in Zoe and Felix’s garden just in time to go to the lab to see what Zim and Zam’s amazing discovery is! They jump into the Okidoodle and go to the Cloudship to find Zim, Zam and Zoom with loads of clocks and the amazing discovery, which is… a door. The trio look unimpressed. But it turns out to be a time machine!

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Its the Okido Circus today and Messy is worried about performing his tripple flip. Will his friends be able to help him conquer his tummy flutters before the audience arrives?

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Plum’s plan to direct a small, simple fairytale play as a surprise performance for the Baby Berrykins snowballs out of control when she hears of the same play being done on a grand scale in Berry Big City. Not listening to Strawberry’s advice to keep it simple, she becomes convinced that unless her production is as big, she’ll be the laughing stock of the berry bitty theatrical world! Casting the girls and Berrykins as stage stars in a sendup of “Snow White and the Seven Dwarves,” Plum attempts to match the spectacular stage effects of a big city theater.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: A preschool boy named Harry receives a bucket full of toy dinosaurs. This bucket holds a secret --- by using its power, Harry can travel with his dinosaurs to an amazing land of imagination called Dino World.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry thinks his delicious cookie has been stolen he goes to Dino-World where he plays at being a detective searching for the thief.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the Southern Californian desert, Jayden encounters a plastic lizard toy, only to be surprised when a greater roadrunner becomes fascinated and runs off with it! Amazed by the birds speed. Leo, Katie and Hero are having a race which ends in a disagreement between Katie and Hero who are at a draw for second place. Their disagreement is interrupted when Jayden calls them to share the discovery which concerns them that the bird might eat the toy which prompts them to travel to Jayden to get the toy lizard back. They chase after the roadrunner, trying to get the toy out of the lizard’s mouth using their gadgets but to no avail. They stop chasing when the bird flies away for a little bit, worried it could fly away from them but it triggers the question why it didn’t just fly away from the start? They meet up with Ranger Rocky who calls Ranger Joey and they learn about the roadrunners affinity for sunbathing and desert plants and guides the rangers to find it, but an unexpected threat emerges as a rattlesnake approaches the bird.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Yong Bao tells Thomas the story of how he came to have a magnificent tiger emblem on his tender

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Gordon and Rebecca do the same work, but differently. When Rebecca tries to be more like Gordon, it does not go well

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: A rare bird, the Picking Bird, is in the forest for a very short time, and Dr. Natureza wants to be the first to take a photo. But she caught a terrible cold, so it will be up to Grisù to help her as a wildlife photographer. Exploring the forest is an exciting adventure for Grisù and Stella, but the mysterious bird isn’t easy to spot. Plus Fume, who’s searching ingredients for a dragon recipe, unintentionally messes up with Grisù’s mission. In the end, however, Grisù understands that the bird is attracted by sparkling stuff. So he comes up with an inventive way to take the perfect picture just before sunset.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu, with Stella’s help, has to babysit and feed a little sea lion while Dr. Natureza is healing its mother. They must prevent the cub from reaching the sea and get lost, but the baby is pretty lively and the mission is not so easy. When the sea lion goes missing, a quest begins. Eventually, the little dragon realizes that the sea lions are very sociable animals, and they love to play, so he will create an improvised fun fair to get the cub back, avoiding other getaways.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Field Mouse and Little Nutbrown Hare’s favourite tree falls over in a summer storm. Theyre sad until they discover the fallen tree provides an exciting new place to explore.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are inspired to make a spider’s web, but run into all sorts of comic trouble when they do.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Hoot and Toot must decide the best order in which to do three jobs: pick up the Mayor, clean the tunnel with the scrub-a-chug and have a chugwash. Deciding they should look their best for the Mayor, they have a chugwash first. Then they clean the tunnels – which gets them filthy again! They’re afraid they won’t earn their badges – until they use the scrub-a-chug to clean themselves. Now sparkling, they pick up the Mayor and Vee awards them their badges!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Pico and Rosie do not agree with the day’s plans made by their respective families. Pico dreams of having some independence while Rose wants calm and attention. They decide to change places.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: After a solar panel demonstration, Mayor Madison decrees that the Sea Life Center will be entirely powered by renewable energy. Bob and the team must build a wind farm, which excites Scoop - he cant wait to see the spinny things going round. As they begin construction, Mr Bentley arrives and pulls Bob away, enthusing about other renewable energy schemes they have planned. Spring City will need more energy as it grows, so they need to think ahead. Scoop decides he should think ahead like Mr Bentley suggests, and convinces Lofty to move some of the turbines closer together.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob announces there’s been a Spring City Clock Competition to design the new Spring City Clock – and guess who’s won? The Spring City Rockets! Bob shows the Machines their winning design and explains that metal figures will emerge and sound the bells on the clock. Wendy has been welding the metal figures together. Leo arrives and is looking forward to helping Bob with the decorative cladding around the clock tower but Bob tells him it’s Recycling Day today and his job is to take all the recycling to the Centre first. Bob and the Machines set off to the site while Leo and Muck gather up the boxes of recycling from around the Yard. But Leo is in such a hurry that he mistakes the box with the metal figures in for recycling and dumps it at the Recycling Centre.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: It seems some sort of monster is causing havoc in Busytown Lake. The kids catch glimpses of it and find numerous finny footprints by the shoreline. However closer investigation reveals it to be Mr Fix-It’s latest invention – a swim fin-wheeled amphibious submarine car!/Huckle and his pals try to track down a bad driver.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo, Katie and Hero travel to the forest to return an equatorial spitting cobra to its home. Things heat up when the Junior Rangers and slithery serpent are ambushed by mongooses.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The discovery of a green iguana in the garden leads to an adventure in the rainforest! The Junior Rangers want nothing more than to find the iguana’s home, but a hungry hawk has other plans for the iguana.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Its Superhero Day, so Simon and Gaspard dress up as SuperRabbit and Captain Rabbit and do all kinds of superhero things - that is, until its time for school...

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: As the end of summer approaches, the Lightning Beetle visits the fireflies and surprises them with a new book about planets and stars. After a conversation, one little firefly, when the others were already asleep, sets out to conquer the sky, but becomes completely exhausted and crashes. Doctor Owl diagnoses him with a fever and possible pneumonia, so he stays with him to heal. The other fireflies decide to surprise him. With the help of Berry, Dolly, Balthazar, Stanley, Flutter, and Eddy, they make colourful orbs, and the Lightning Beetle crafts the Sun. They suspend the planets on a hoop, which Eddy rotates with a contraption. They also instal tiny lights, resembling stars.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry wants to perform magic, but Stanley and Balthazar tease him. Berry borrows Katies magic box, learns tricks, and puts on a show for his friends. The tricks amaze the audience, especially when Berry successfully performs real magic by summoning rain.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The little friends decide to get rid of their old, unwanted items and organize a yard sale in the meadow. The old items lead to a lively barter, but a large pile of useless junk remains. The rubbishtruck of the quick beetles arrives to help, taking away the remaining items and assisting in cleaning the meadow.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble catches a cold, and Dr. Owl suggests drinking elderflower tea. Flutter sets out to gather elderflowers and meets Harmony, the glass-winged butterfly. Harmony teaches Flutter how to make the tea properly. Thanks to the delicious drink, Bubble soon recovers, and they celebrate spring with their new friend Harmony over a tasty elderflower syrup.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, finds a strange little fish in the stream, which turns out to be a lost polliwog. Although Alfonso is sad when the polliwog returns to its frog family, their friendship doesnt end. Alfonso visits his tadpole friend every day, who soon develops into a real little frog.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: During a big storm, lightning strikes the lookout tower, setting it ablaze. Berry, Dolly, and their friends immediately alert the firefighter beetles. The brave firefighters arrive quickly, extinguish the fire, and save the tower from greater damage. The little team works together to repair the roof, and Eddy installs a lightning rod to make the tower safer. At the end of the day, everyone thanks the heroic fire beetles.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends watch slides and then play a lively game of shadow puppets. They continue the game in front of a rock wall, forming funny shapes. Bubble, the little rose beetle, gets scared by the strange shadows on the wall, thinking a giant monster has moved into the forest. Luckily, Christopher, the canary, helps clarify the misunderstanding. Bubble and Christopher join the fun shadow play.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are having so much fun playing together, they dont want to say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly loses the sack of Christmas wishes, and Tildas oven breaks. Thankfully, a wandering craftsman returns the sack and fixes the oven. But Tilda is sad—Aunt Emily can’t come for Christmas due to a broken leg.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda has invited her friends for Christmas, but a heavy snowfall prevents them from arriving. Luckily, Gertrude the mole digs a tunnel to Tilda’s house, ensuring the party can take place!

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One morning, Molly knocks excitedly on Tildas door: theres going to be a knitting competition in the village. Tilda and Molly at once set off to the village shop to buy some wool. All the other inhabitants of Wild Rose Lane are also buying knitting materials. The competition makes rivals of the friends and they work alone, quietly and secretly.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s a fine Autumn day and it seems that all of the meadow creatures are out enjoying the sun. He sets out to trick him into believing there is a brand new animal… called a ‘Grrr-umph’, which he cleverly creates out of shadows! Will Big Nutbrown Hare be tricked?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that everyone else can whistle but him… the birds, Little Grey Squirrel, Otter and even the wind in the river reeds. Inspired by the wind, he practices really hard and eventually learns to blow through a reed himself to make it whistle. He and his friends make a beautiful and eerie whistling symphony amongst the reeds.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare tries to jump high enough to reach a last Autumn apple on a high branch. Unable to reach it, even with the help of Little Field Mouse, he gives up. But after watching some little salmon struggling to swim up a waterfall he decides to ‘think like a fish’ and try, try, try again until he reaches the tasty prize.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Daddy has thrown out his back! Simon and Gaspard take over the household duties and decide they will do all of daddys chores before Mommy comes home from work. Thanks little bunnies!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger

programme.desc: To earn their badges, the trainees must be efficient when picking up litter, which means not wasting any time. Wilson and Koko race off, each determined to finish first. Methodical Brewster goes more slowly, sorting the litter as he goes into 3 different bins: paper, plastic and cans. Koko and Wilson deliver their messy loads to the recycling yard – but it won’t count until it’s sorted! While a happy Brewster collects his badge, Koko and Wilson are still sorting their litter....

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest

He learns that by concentrating and breathing deeply he can control his need to make noise. Not only does he earn his badge, he gets the extra reward of seeing loads of wonderful animals that only come out when it’s quiet!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi comes down for breakfast this particular morning, he finds the kitchen in a total mess! Nina comes and tells him that the vegetable garden has also been turned upside down! Who could possibly have done this?... At first, they suspect Ciboulette the cat… until they find out that the culprit is a super cute newcomer.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi and Nina are very excited today as Mom and Dad have organized a treasure hunt for them in the forest! Tchoupi is very confident he’ll find the treasure in no time as he and Nina have prepared for it. As they move from clue to clue, the two friends have fun discovering other aspects of the forest, but Tchoupi starts to get impatient: why’s it taking so long to find the treasure??

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are busy playing as the chickens roam free in the orchard, pecking for food. But when it comes to bringing the birds back home, they notice Picorette is missing! programme.desc: Julia found a gift in her mothers closet and she thinks it is hers. With Sams help, our impatient Julia tries to figure out what is in the package but destroy a part of it. How to it back as it was?

programme.desc: Monkey created a banana peels hat for national hat day but it fall apart, Monkey needs new inspiration. programme.title: Fireman Sam

programme.title: Fireman Sam
